Detailed Description

The Inventory class that deals with storing and checking items/events/actions the player encounters during gameplay

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Inventory::Inventory (  ) 

Constructor for an empty inventory object

Member Function Documentation

void Inventory::add ( string  identifier  ) 

Removes the named item from the inventory by setting the boolean which represents the player's current possession of the item to 'false'

Parameters:
identifier The name of the item to be removed from the player's possession
bool Inventory::check ( string  identifier  ) 

Checks if the item/identifier is currently in the player's possession

Parameters:
identifier The name of the item/action/event to check for player's possession
Returns:
returns 'True' if identifier is in players possession or 'False' if not
void Inventory::clear (  ) 

Clears the sto member variable (clears the player's inventory)

void Inventory::forget ( string  identifier  ) 

Removes the named item from the inventory by setting the boolean which represents the player's current possession of the item to 'false'

Parameters:
identifier The name of the item to be removed from the player's possession
void Inventory::load ( istream &   ) 

Loads the game information (inventory, current area, time) from a text file

Parameters:
istream The input file stream to extract data to be loaded
void Inventory::print (  ) 

Prints the players inventory

void Inventory::save ( ostream &   ) 

Saves the game information (inventory, current area, time) to a text file

Parameters:
ostream The output file stream to insert data to be saved
